alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Natrona County Lower Elevations; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN NATRONA AND SOUTHWESTERN JOHNSON COUNTIES THROUGH 1245 PM MDT... At 1200 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Mayoworth to 9 miles west of Antelope Hills. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. A brief funnel cloud is possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mayoworth around 1210 PM MDT. Kaycee around 1215 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Teapot Rock. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 193 and 276. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Natrona County Lower Elevations; Southeast Johnson County
